:v: eric-wieser can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Thanks for filling out the StarOrderedRing API to clean it up! It's a shame how much boilerplate this needed to write some really obvious lemmas!
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10360681534/job/28679592761)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10360681534/job/28679592612)

other than the conversation I unresolved above with one last comment, this looks good. Thanks!

bors d+

Mostly seems fine, but I've left a few comments. I may try to golf one of these later. It's a bit sad we have to duplicate all the API from transpose to conjTranpose, but I don't really see an alternative.

other than the conversation I unresolved above with one last comment, this looks good. Thanks!

bors d+

Am I right that in this generality you could get the related but different result where the hypothesis on `a` is nonnegativity and regularity and the conclusion is regularity? 

If so, do you mind adding it?
This is misnamed and contains a `sorry`.
Whoops, I meant to unrequest your review when I split this PR, but I guess I failed to do so.

It looks like you copied all these docstrings from the few declarations below, but they're all wrong? I think they apply to `â„‚` via `RCLike.toStarOrderedRing`, which is available in the `ComplexOrder` scope.
I think this was accurate at the time, but is no longer.
I think you can remove the `by refine` here.
Can you not make this `0 â‰¤ (d : â„¤)` here?
`Int.cast_pos` doesn't apply in a `StarOrderedRing`; are there cases where it doesn't hold?

No, it works (aside from the zero ring, obviously), but we don't have the `Int` stuff generalized. It all generalizes pretty trivially just like we did for `Nat` a while ago. We're also missing an instance for `StarOrderedRing`, namely `ZeroLEOneClass`.
```lean
import Mathlib

namespace Int

variable {R : Type*} [AddCommGroupWithOne R] [PartialOrder R] [CovariantClass R R (Â· + Â·) (Â· â‰¤ Â·)]
variable [ZeroLEOneClass R] [NeZero (1 : R)]

lemma cast_mono' : Monotone (Int.cast : â„¤ â†’ R) := by
  intro m n h
  rw [â† sub_nonneg] at h
  lift n - m to â„• using h with k hk
  rw [â† sub_nonneg, â† cast_sub, â† hk, cast_natCast]
  exact k.cast_nonneg'

variable {m n : â„¤}

@[simp] lemma cast_nonneg' : âˆ€ {n : â„¤}, (0 : R) â‰¤ n â†” 0 â‰¤ n
  | (n : â„•) => by simp
  | -[n+1] => by
    have : -(n : R) < 1 := lt_of_le_of_lt (by simp) zero_lt_one
    simpa [(negSucc_lt_zero n).not_le, â† sub_eq_add_neg, le_neg] using this.not_le

@[simp, norm_cast] lemma cast_le' : (m : R) â‰¤ n â†” m â‰¤ n := by
  rw [â† sub_nonneg, â† cast_sub, cast_nonneg', sub_nonneg]

lemma cast_strictMono' : StrictMono (fun x : â„¤ => (x : R)) :=
  strictMono_of_le_iff_le fun _ _ => cast_le'.symm

@[simp, norm_cast] lemma cast_lt' : (m : R) < n â†” m < n := cast_strictMono'.lt_iff_lt

@[simp] lemma cast_nonpos' : (n : R) â‰¤ 0 â†” n â‰¤ 0 := by rw [â† cast_zero, cast_le']

@[simp] lemma cast_pos' : (0 : R) < n â†” 0 < n := by rw [â† cast_zero, cast_lt']

@[simp] lemma cast_lt_zero' : (n : R) < 0 â†” n < 0 := by rw [â† cast_zero, cast_lt']

end Int

variable {R : Type*} [Ring R] [StarRing R] [PartialOrder R] [StarOrderedRing R] [NeZero (1 : R)]

-- generalizes to `Semiring R`
instance : ZeroLEOneClass R where
  zero_le_one := by simpa using star_mul_self_nonneg (1 : R)

open Int
example {n : â„¤} : (0 : R) < n â†” 0 < n := by rw [â† cast_zero, cast_lt']
```
Do you have time to PR the above?
Maybe not for a few days. If you don't get to it before me, I'll do it.
@eric-wieser see #15185 and #15186
Thanks! I've simplified the lemma statements now.
@eric-wieser It looks like this one is still `â†” 0 â‰¤ (d : R)` instead of `â†” 0 â‰¤ d`.

```suggestion
    PosSemidef (d : Matrix n n R) â†” 0 â‰¤ d :=
```
